isWaivable

public java.lang.Boolean isWaivable()
Description copied from interface: InspectorDescriptor
Some violations can be waived, for example empty catch block might be justifiable in some situations. But other violations can not. For example there is no reason to waive Upper L Rule.

Specified by:
isWaivable in interface InspectorDescriptor
Returns:
TRUE if violation can be waived.

getAfterInspectorNames

public java.util.Collection getAfterInspectorNames()
Specified by:
getAfterInspectorNames in interface InspectorDescriptor
Returns:
Collection of names of inspectors whose visit() methods shall be invoked after this inspector's visit() methods and whose leave() methods shall be invoked before this inspector leave() method.

Specified by:
getFilteredInspectorDesriptors in interface InspectorDescriptor
Parameters:
inspectorSet - Inspector set to read descriptors from
